page.title: 09Unemployment in Leicester
page.content: From the figures obtained in the{1981 {Census,}the unemployment rate in Leicester was{20%.}Figures for{June {1985}show that{28200}economically active persons are out of work. The highest rates of unemployment fall within the age groups of{16-19}and{ {60-64.}These figures alter according to Government definitions eg housewives and school leavers on{Youth {Training Schemes}are not included in the figures. There are schemes and facilities offered by the{City Council,}for the unemployed of Leicester. These include sports centres, swimming baths and adult education schemes.{White people} hold a disproportionate percentage of jobs in the City. However, more{Asians are now tending to become self employed.
